definitions: To change the form, character, or function of something.
To cause to change from one religion, belief, political party, or way of life to another.
To exchange something for something else of a different form, type, or value.
To change units or values from one system to another.
To score an extra point or points after a touchdown in American football.
examples: They plan to convert the old factory into apartments.
She decided to convert to a new faith.
You can convert your foreign currency at the bank.
We need to convert meters to feet.
The team failed to convert the extra point.
